title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, January 23, 1866
summary: How recommends that a Thomas Wholey be allowed to take lumber from an abandoned barracks in Staunton, and that the black community should use the remaining lumber for the construction of a church.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Church/Religious Activity, Economy, Military Authority, Patriotism, Property, American Civil War
